answers.answer: Excessive drinking and urinating can be signs of endocrine disorders such as diabetes, and Hyperadrenocorticism, urinary tract infections and kidney disease, and steriod use.  Changes in nose color and texture can be signs of immune-mediated disorders and allergies and more.  Please have your vet do complete blood work and a urinalysis and then let me know if I may be of further assistance.

question: my pom's nose has dried out and changed colors.  it used to be black, about a year ago it started turning pinkish brown.  now it is dry and hard like a calous.  the vet says she may have sinusitis.  her neck glands felt swollen and she had some temp.  he gave her an antibiotic.  the last month, she has quit jumping up on the furniture, quit sleeping with me, she drinks excessively and pees all over the house.  she has never been 100% housebroke, but about 75%.  now she will only use her potty paper if i put her on it or sometimes stand by it and tell her to potty on the paper.  she is not as playful as normal.  her appetite is still the same.  the only health problem she has ever had is itching.  lat summer she had a steriod shot and then again in november.  it took care of the allergy problem.  i'm worried that her nose is not cold and wet anymore!
title: 3 year old pom
